summary: I think a lot of people had a problem with Bran speaking about Sansa's wedding night. But for me, I felt Bran may very well have...
question: I think a lot of people had a problem with Bran speaking about Sansa's wedding night. But for me, I felt Bran may very well have seen what Sansa went through, and he tells her he's sorry she had to go through such horrors in their own home. His emotional senses are very dulled now and his sense of propriety has gone down too (like how he dismissed Meera the way he did), yet he still had enough to let Sansa know he understands she went through hell and empathized with her plight.
answer: I admit I was pretty bitter that he never brought up anyone else’s traumas, just Sansa’s. Like what was the point? Did Sansa express a need to hear someone tell her they empathised with her because of that? If they had written that scene it would have at least shown Bran trying to reach out through the wall of incalculable knowledge he has acquired. At least because of that scene no one can accuse Sansa of stealing his inheritance or anything and despite the show barely featuring Bran I did like the other scenes that they shared. Hopefully S8 will bring more Sansa and Bran because he’s her favourite brother.

Hopefully S8 will bring more Sansa and Bran because he’s her favourite brother.

summary: ASOIAF characters + TES deities ❯ Bran Stark - Hermaeus Mora ❝His sphere is the scrying of the tides of Fate, of the past and...
caption:
ASOIAF characters + TES deities
❯ Bran Stark - Hermaeus Mora

❝His sphere is the scrying of the tides of Fate, of the past and future as read in the stars and heavens. He is not known for being good or evil; he seems to be the keeper of both helpful and destructive knowledge, although he usually sees all seekers of any knowledge as his servants. His Plane of Oblivion, the Apocrypha, is an endless library where all forbidden knowledge can be found. Those who wander into Apocrypha in search of truth are often lost there forever.❞

blog.title: turtle-paced
blog.description: Writing at the speed of the race course paradox.

summary: Hi turtle - thank you for this lovely blog. I'd like to ask - among Rickon, Bran, Arya, Sansa and Jon, which of the Stark family...
question: Hi turtle - thank you for this lovely blog. I'd like to ask - among Rickon, Bran, Arya, Sansa and Jon, which of the Stark family do you think will be the first pair to reunite? Do you think they'll have some proper time together, where they can talk about their childhood, what they experienced since they split and their plans for their future/the North? Or do you think they will reunite during a time of chaos, so it's more 'so great you're alive, gtg the zombies are coming?'
answer:
Thanks very much!

I tend to think Jon and Sansa will be first to reunite, given that they’re physically the closest to Winterfell. Don’t know which of Arya or Bran makes it back first, and I don’t know how Rickon figures into this (though I am afraid he won’t survive). And yeah, I think they’ll have time to speak to each other - if nothing else, I think Jon, Sansa, Arya and Bran manage to speak to and grieve with each other as they inter Ned’s bones in Winterfell’s crypts.

tags: bran is a very unique character
summary: Were there any characters in F&B who paralleled Bran?
question: Were there any characters in F&B who paralleled Bran?
answer:
Not really? I don’t think? Maybe I’m missing something, but as a given Bran’s major character features – a “broken boy” who becomes the heir to a great magical power – would of course not appear in a Targaryen-focused history book written by a skeptic maester.

Though there were a few vague connections on the potential political side of Bran’s story, I suppose. Alaric Stark was a second son whose father died because of a visit to King’s Landing (nothing political, he was just old and sick, and the stress of travel was too much), and his older brother Walton didn’t last long as lord, dying in a rebellion (and killed horribly if that counts). Jaehaerys also has the thing where he has to step into the shoes of an older brother whose reign was nipped in the bud, plus hiding far from home, but those are really unspecific parallels. And poor Aegon III is often referred to as the Broken King, but that’s emotionally rather than physically.

Maybe someone else noticed something I didn’t, some minor throwaway line I missed, but really I don’t think there’s anything else close to Bran’s story in this book. I think this is it, sorry, but hope this helps!

blog.title: Jonsa is my Ship
blog.description: But I respect all other ships..No fandom wars please, Only love .. no hate!!

summary: Did the Night king brand Bran?
body:
Did the Night king brand Bran?

I’ve never really understood the significance of this scene- when the night king touches Bran. Whatever magic prevented the NK from entering that cave was destroyed the moment he left his mark on Bran. That part I got BUT…

Does that also mean that he could defeat the magic of the wall because Bran crosses the wall still bearing his mark?

And do they share some kind of a connection now like Harry and Voldemort?

If you have answers, I’d really love to know what you think coz I just feel like it’s important.

reblog.comment:

summary: There has been some recent speculation online that Bran is going to be, in one way or another, ruler of Westeros by the end of...
question: There has been some recent speculation online that Bran is going to be, in one way or another, ruler of Westeros by the end of ASOIAF. Do you think this is possible based on your readings of the books?
answer:
No. I think if Bran rules anywhere, it’ll be in Winterfell, and regardless of title I doubt he takes up day-to-day ruling, juggling competing factions and the fluctuations of the winter economy. Bran understands Winterfell differently to the way its temporal rulers do:

When he got out from under it and scrambled up near the sky, Bran could see all of Winterfell in a glance. He liked the way it looked, spread out beneath him, only birds wheeling over his head while all the life of the castle went on below. Bran could perch for hours among the shapeless, rain-worn gargoyles that brooded over the First Keep, watching it all: the men drilling with wood and steel in the yard, the cooks tending their vegetables in the glass garden, restless dogs running back and forth in the kennels, the silence of the godswood, the girls gossiping beside the washing well. It made him feel like he was lord of the castle, in a way even Robb would never know.

- Bran II, AGoT

I tend to think that the work of his life is to enable Winterfell to stand, thrive, and protect against winter, for another few thousand years.

blog.title: All it takes is a little faith and a lot of heart, sweetheart.
blog.description:
Tea the Turtleduck.

Sometimes I draw. Sometimes I write. Sometimes I'm scared of you.

COMMISSIONS OPEN

tags: And before any misguided soul gets worked up over my comics
I'd like to once again point out the tag
So yes these are wildly inaccurate portrayals of the characters
And yes they are for fun and laughs
And no I am in no way claiming these are accurate to canon
And just scroll past if these offend you

blog.description: Hello loves🔥 my name is Crystal ❤️/ 20 / Black 😘/ England native / Game of thrones is LIFE ♥ Star wars is LIFE 🖤/jonerys IS my life😍/kit and emilia are goals/positivity and laughter all around/ so if you don't like what I put here oh wells x
